channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Have your say: are you hyped for the Samsung Galaxy S26 series, or is it a load of meh?
item.description: Evolution over revolution could make the Samsung Galaxy S26 series feel a bit shrug-worthy. Or I could be wrong; let me know what you think.

item.title: The crypto bill is falling apart in Congress
item.description: Hello and welcome to Regulator, the Verge newsletter about the technology politics happening in our nation's capital. I hope our snowstorm-affected readers are safe, warm, and haven't reenacted The Shining at home yet. Do you know what prevents that? Subscribing to The Verge. Last week, when I was tracking Coinbase's opposition to the Clarity Act, […]...

item.title: I’m all for weird tech, and this viral AI sticker maker has just shot to the top of my list of recent obsessions
item.description: Stickerbox by Hapiko has taken social media by storm. Here's how it uses generative AI to make custom stickers.

item.title: FAA Could Have Prevented Fatal D.C. Plane Collision, Investigation Finds
item.description: The FAA has yet to learn from its mistakes, according to officials.

item.title: The best Android phones
item.description: The Android ecosystem is all about choice. While iPhone owners have a smaller pool of new devices to pick from when it’s time to upgrade, there’s a wider range of choices on Android. Some Android phones even fold in half! Imagine. On the flip side, all that choice can make for some hard decisions. Here’s […]

item.title: Who needs 5G, or even 6G? New breakthrough can transmit at 15 gigabytes per second - that's enough for a whole weekend's worth of movies
item.description: UC Irvine researchers developed a 140GHz transceiver achieving 15 GB/s, overcoming DAC limits while reducing power consumption and simplifying production.

item.title: Everything you need to know about viral personal AI assistant Clawdbot (now Moltbot)
item.description: Personal AI assistant Moltbot —formerly Clawdbot — has gone viral in a matter of weeks. But there’s more you should know before jumping on the bandwagon.
